snippet: The agency that administers Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac said it had concluded after months of study that the costs of debt forgiveness outweighed the potential benefits.
abstract: Federal Housing Finance Agency, the independent agency that administers Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, says it will not let the mortgage companies offer debt forgiveness to borrowers; announcement is a direct rebuff to the Obama administration, which has pressed for more than a year for the agency to join nearly every other mortgage company in offering debt forgiveness to borrowers who owe more than the value of their homes.
lead_paragraph: The agency that administers Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac said it had concluded after months of study that the costs of debt forgiveness outweighed the potential benefits.
